greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest prime factor of n-th triangular number.
comment: Or, a(1) = 1, then the smallest nontrivial k (>1) which divides the sum of (next n) numbers from k+1 to k+n or smallest k > 1 that divides nk + n(n+1)/2. - _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 22 2002. For example, a(7) = 4, which is the smallest nontrivial number that divides the sum 5+6+...+11, of 7 numbers.
link: Zak Seidov, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 10 2002
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 06 2008 at the suggestion of _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_
